column13: Base salary is intended to provide a fixed compensation component commensurate with each executive's seniority, skill set, experience, role, and responsibilities. Over the fiscal year 2023, base salaries were modestly increased.

Amcor provides their NEOs with a short-term incentive ("STI") through an annual, performance-based incentive program that delivers compensation based on achieving yearly business objectives. Part of any STI earned is delivered in restricted share units ("RSUs") that are deferred for an additional period of two years ("STI-Deferred Equity Plan Awards").

The objective of our LTI plan is to reward the achievement of long-term sustainable business outcomes, which is consistent with the Company's aim of value creation for our shareholders. LTI awards granted during the fiscal year 2023 consist of a grant of options and performance rights (performance shares, in the case of U.S. participants) with a three-year performance period that began July 1, 2022, and will end June 30, 2025.

Each of our NEOs has entered into an executive services agreement, which generally provides compensation terms (including base salary, STI and LTI opportunity, and retention incentives in limited circumstances) and other perquisites and benefits described elsewhere in the "Executive Compensation Discussion and Analysis" section. The executive services agreements require a 12-month notice period to terminate the services agreement, although the Company may waive any portion of the notice period.

A minimum shareholding policy is in place to strengthen the alignment of the interests of our NEOs with value creation for our shareholders. Under the maximum shareholding policy, our CEO and each of our CEO's direct reports, including our NEOs, must build and maintain a minimum shareholding of Amcor shares.

Amcor equity award agreements contain a provision restricting participants from hedging or pledging the value of the award or entering into a derivative agreement concerning the prize. Equity award recipients include our executive officers, Directors and specific employees.

A clawback policy is in place that allows the Board of Directors to cancel awards in the event of fraud, dishonesty, breach of obligations, financial misstatements, or if awards were made based on a misrepresentation or an omission, or based on facts or circumstances that were later proven to be untrue or inaccurate. In addition, the Compensation Committee intends to adopt a clawback policy before December 2, 2023, to reflect applicable changes in law and NYSE listing standards, including the requirements of the final regulations adopted by the SEC.

The Compensation Committee has reviewed and discussed the Compensation Discussion and Analysis required by Item 402(b) of Regulation S-K with management and, based on such review and discussion. The Compensation Committee recommended to the Board that the Compensation Discussion and Analysis be included in the proxy statement.

column13: In 2018, Amcor became the first global packaging company to pledge to make all its products recyclable, compostable, or reusable by 2025. Amcor understood that to shape the future, Amcor needed to rethink its present.

Amcor has added more ambitious targets to its sustainability agenda in recent years. Amcor has increased its target on recycled content usage across the Amcor portfolio to 30% by 2030 and established vital supplier partnerships to access recycled materials that can be used in their customers' packaging across the globe.

A Science-Based Target (SBT) refers to Amcor's goals and objectives to reduce its greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions in line with the latest climate science. These targets are designed to contribute to the global effort to mitigate climate change and limit global warming to below 2 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels, as outlined in the Paris Agreement.

A "net-zero emissions aspiration" refers to a commitment made by Amcor to balance the greenhouse gases they emit and those they remove from the atmosphere. The ultimate goal is to bring the net emissions to zero, halting the contribution to climate change.

Amcor partnered with customers worldwide on exciting new packaging launches, such as our collaboration with a customer in Australia to transition some of its well-known brands to high-performance recyclable paper-based packaging.

Every year, Amcor invest approximately USD 100 million in research and development to bring new products and solutions across various materials to market. However, Amcor also understands that the full potential of its innovations can only be realized through collective efforts on ineffective packaging collection, improved recycling infrastructure, and consumer participation in returning used packaging to the recycling stream.

Amcor had to work with their customers and suppliers and proactively engage with non-governmental organizations, academics and cross-industry bodies such as the Alliance to End Plastic Waste, the Consumer Goods Forum and the Business Coalition to End Plastic Pollution. In partnership with Delterra, Mars and P&G, we are collaborating to develop upstream and downstream solutions for a circular plastics economy in the Global South.

Amcor collaborates with organizations in the education field to shape tomorrow's talents. Amcor partnered with Michigan State University and supports leading-edge packaging start-ups and the next generation of innovators via our Amcor Lift-Off initiative.

Desktop research refers to gathering information and conducting research using electronic resources, typically from a computer or desktop environment, rather than through fieldwork or hands-on physical investigation. This type of research relies on existing data, documents, publications, and online sources to gather information on a particular topic.

Interviewing stakeholders is crucial to project management, business analysis, and decision-making processes. Stakeholders are individuals or groups who have an interest in or are affected by the outcomes of a project or decision.

Conducting surveys is a common and effective way to gather stakeholder feedback and insights into various projects, initiatives, or decision-making processes. Effective surveys can be powerful tools for engaging stakeholders, gathering valuable insights, and making informed decisions.
